turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: But if you want facts, Indy, I have none to give you. At my age, I'm prepared to take a few things on faith.

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: Call Donovan, Marcus. Tell him I'll take that ticket to Venice now.

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: I'll tell him we'll take two.

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: Ah, Venice...

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: Yes. Uh, how will we recognize this Doctor Schneider when we see him?

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: I don't know. Maybe he'll know us.

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: That doesn't look much like a library.

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: It looks like a converted church.

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: Marcus -- I've seen this window before.

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: Where?

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: Look, Indy. The Roman numerals!

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: Dad was onto something here!

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: Well, now we know the source of the numbers, but we still don't know what they mean.

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: How's the head?

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: It's better, now I've seen this. It's the name of a city. "Alexandretta?" Hmmm...

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: The present city of Iskenderun is built on its ruins. Marcus -- you remember what the Grail Tablet said. "Across the desert and through the mountain to the Canyon of the Crescent Moon."  But where exactly?

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: Your father would know. Your father did know. Look. He made a map.

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: Now, he knew there was a city with an oasis due east. Here. He knew the course turned south through the desert to a river, and the river led into the mountains. Here. Straight to the canyon. He knew everything except where to begin, the name of the city.

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: Alexandretta. Now we know.

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: Yes. Now we know.

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: Marcus, get hold of Sallah. Tell him to meet you in Iskenderun.

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: What about you?

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: I'm going after Dad.

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: Indy... Indy, you must hurry!! Come quickly!

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: It's... a leap of faith. Oh, God.

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: Marcus!

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: Arghhh! Oh!

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: Henry! What are you doing here?!

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: It's a rescue, old boy. Come on.

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: Henry, the pen --

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: But don't you see? The pen is mightier than the sword.

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: Look what you did!

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: It's war.

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: The Word of God...

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: No, Henry. Try not to talk.

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: The Name of God...

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: Indy! Henry! Follow met I know the way!  Haaa!

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: Got lost in his own museum, huh?

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: Tell me, what's going to happen when we get to Venice?

turns.speaker: DONOVAN
turns.text: Don't worry. Doctor Schneider will be there to meet you.

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: Schneider?

turns.speaker: DONOVAN
turns.text: I maintain an apartment in Venice, at your disposal.

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: Oh, well. That's good. Thank you.

turns.speaker: DONOVAN
turns.text: Care to wet your whistle, Marcus?

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: I'd rather spit in your face. But as I haven't got any spit...

turns.speaker: DONOVAN
turns.text: Well, Marcus, we are on the brink of the recovery of the greatest artifact in the history of mankind.

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: You're meddling with powers you cannot possibly comprehend.

turns.speaker: BUTLER
turns.text: Are you expected?

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: Don't take that tone with me, my good man. Now buttle off and tell Baron Brunwald that Lord Clarence MacDonald and his lovely assistant are here to view the tapestries.

turns.speaker: BUTLER
turns.text: Tapestries?

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: Dear me, the man is dense. This is a castle, isn't it? There are tapestries?

turns.speaker: BUTLER
turns.text: This is a castle. And we have many tapestries. But if you're a Scottish lord, then I am Mickey Mouse.

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: How dare he?!

turns.speaker: DONOVAN
turns.text: My name is Donovan. Walter Donovan.

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: I know who you are Mr. Donovan. Your contributions to the museum over the years have been extremely generous. Some of the pieces in your collection here are very impressive.

turns.speaker: DONOVAN
turns.text: Well, like yourself, Doctor Jones, I have a passion for antiquities.  Have a look over here. This might interest you.

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: Well, it's sandstone. Christian symbol. Early Latin text. Mid-Twelfth Century, I should think.

turns.speaker: DONOVAN
turns.text: That was our assessment as well.

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: Where did this come from?

turns.speaker: DONOVAN
turns.text: My engineers unearthed it in the mountain region north of Ankara while excavating for copper.  Can you translate the inscription?

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: "Where the cup that holds the blood of Jesus Christ resides forever."

turns.speaker: DONOVAN
turns.text: The Holy Grail, Doctor Jones. The chalice used by Christ during the Last Supper. The cup that caught His blood at the Crucifixion and was entrusted to Joseph of Arimathaea.

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: The Arthur Legend. I've heard this bedtime story before.

turns.speaker: DONOVAN
turns.text: Eternal life, Doctor Jones! The gift of youth to whoever drinks from the Grail.  Oh, now that's a bedtime story I'd like to wake up to!

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: An old man's dream.

turns.speaker: DONOVAN
turns.text: Every man's dream.  Including your father's, I believe.

turns.speaker: DONOVAN
turns.text: Hard to resist, isn't it? The Holy Grail's final resting place described in detail!

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: What good is it? This Grail Tablet speaks of deserts and mountains and canyons. Pretty vague. Where do you start looking? Maybe if the Tablet were intact, you'd have something to go on. But the entire top portion is missing.

turns.speaker: DONOVAN
turns.text: Just the same, an attempt to recover the Grail is currently underway.

turns.speaker: DONOVAN
turns.text: Let me tell you another "bedtime story," Doctor Jones. After the Grail was entrusted to Joseph of Arimathaea, it disappeared and was lost for a thousand years before it was found again by three Knights of the First Crusade. Three brothers, to be exact.

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: I've heard this one as well. Two of these brothers walked out of the desert one hundred and fifty years after having found the Grail and began the long journey back to France. But only one of them made it. And before dying of extreme old age, he supposedly imparted his tale to a -- to a Franciscan friar, I think.

turns.speaker: DONOVAN
turns.text: Not "supposedly," Doctor Jones.

turns.speaker: DONOVAN
turns.text: This is the manuscript in which the friar chronicled the Knight's story... it doesn't reveal on location of the Grail, I'm afraid... but the Knight promised that two "markers" that had been left behind would.  This Tablet is one of those "markers." It proves the Knight's story is true. But as you pointed out -- it's incomplete.  Now, the second "marker" is entombed with the Knight's dead brother. Our project leader believes that tomb to be located within the city of Venice, Italy.  As you can now see, Doctor Jones, we're about to complete a great quest that began almost two thousand years ago. We're only one step away.

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: That's usually when the ground falls out from underneath your feet.

turns.speaker: DONOVAN
turns.text: You could be more right than you know.

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: Yes?

turns.speaker: DONOVAN
turns.text: We've hit a snag. Our project leader has vanished. Along with all his research. Uh, we received a cable from his colleague, Doctor Schneider, who has no idea of his whereabouts or what's become of him.  I want you to pick up the trail where he left off. Find the man and you will find the Grail.

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: You've got the wrong Jones, Mister Donovan. Why don't you try my father?

turns.speaker: DONOVAN
turns.text: We already have. Your father is the man who's disappeared.

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: DONOVAN!

turns.speaker: DONOVAN
turns.text: Didn't I warn you not to trust anybody, Doctor Jones?

turns.speaker: DONOVAN
turns.text: Impossible? What do you say, Jones? Ready to go down in history?

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: As what? A Nazi stooge like you?

turns.speaker: DONOVAN
turns.text: Nazis?! -- Is that the limit of your vision?! The Nazis want to write themselves into the Grail legend and take on the world. Well, they're welcome. But I want the Grail itself. The cup that gives everlasting life. Hitler can have the world, but he can't take it with him. I'm going to be drinking my own health when he's gone the way of the Dodo.  The Grail is mine, and you're going to get it for me.

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: Shooting me won't get you anywhere.

turns.speaker: DONOVAN
turns.text: You know something, Doctor Jones? You're absolutely right.

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: I'm through!

turns.speaker: DONOVAN
turns.text: We're through!

turns.speaker: ELSA
turns.text: Doctor Jones?

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: Yes?

turns.speaker: ELSA
turns.text: I knew it was you --

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: And my mother's ears. But the rest belongs to you.

turns.speaker: ELSA
turns.text: Looks like the best parts have already been spoken for.

turns.speaker: ELSA
turns.text: The last time I saw your father we were in the library. He was very close to tracking down the Knight's Tomb. I've never seen him so excited. He was as giddy as a schoolboy.

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: Who? Attila the Professor? He was never giddy, even when he was a schoolboy!

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: Fraulein -- will you permit me?

turns.speaker: ELSA
turns.text: I usually don't.

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: I usually don't either.

turns.speaker: ELSA
turns.text: In that case, I permit you.

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: It would make me very happy.

turns.speaker: ELSA
turns.text: But I'm already sad -- by tomorrow it will have faded.

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: Tomorrow I'll steal you another.

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: My dad sent me this Diary for a reason. Until we find out why, I suggest we keep it to ourselves.

turns.speaker: ELSA
turns.text: Find something?

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: Bingo.

turns.speaker: ELSA
turns.text: You don't disappoint, Doctor Jones. You're a great deal like your father.

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: Except he's lost, and I'm not.

turns.speaker: ELSA
turns.text: Lower me down.

turns.speaker: ELSA
turns.text: Pagan symbols. Fourth or Fifth Century.

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: Right. Six hundred years before the Crusades.

turns.speaker: ELSA
turns.text: The Christians would have dug their own passages and burial chambers centuries later.

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: The Ark of the Covenant.

turns.speaker: ELSA
turns.text: Are you sure?

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: Pretty sure.

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: It must be one of these...

turns.speaker: ELSA
turns.text: Look at the artistry of these carvings and the scrollwork.

turns.speaker: ELSA
turns.text: What's that?

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: It's a rubbing Dad made of the Grail Tablet.

turns.speaker: ELSA
turns.text: Wouldn't it be wonderful if he were here now to see this?

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: He never would have made it past the rats! He hates rats! He's scared to death of them!

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: Don't wander off.

turns.speaker: ELSA
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: I said go around!

turns.speaker: ELSA
turns.text: You said go between them!

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: I said don't go between them!

turns.speaker: ELSA
turns.text: My room!

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: Mine, too.

turns.speaker: ELSA
turns.text: What were they looking for?

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: This.

turns.speaker: ELSA
turns.text: The Grail Diary.

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: Uh-huh.

turns.speaker: ELSA
turns.text: You had it? You didn't trust me!

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: At least I let you tag along.

turns.speaker: ELSA
turns.text: Oh, yes. Give them a flower and they'll follow you anywhere.

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: Knock it off. You're not mad.

turns.speaker: ELSA
turns.text: No?

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: No. You like the way I do things.

turns.speaker: ELSA
turns.text: It's lucky I don't do things the same way. You'd still be standing at the Venice pier.

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: What do you know about this place?

turns.speaker: ELSA
turns.text: I know the Brunwalds are famous art collectors.

turns.speaker: ELSA
turns.text: What are you going to do?

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: Don't know. Think of something.

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: This one. I think he's in here.

turns.speaker: ELSA
turns.text: How do you know?

turns.speaker: ELSA
turns.text: This book contained a map -- a map with no names -- precise directions from the unknown city to the secret Canyon of the Crescent Moon.

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: So it did.

turns.speaker: ELSA
turns.text: How did you get here?

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: Where is it? I want it.

turns.speaker: ELSA
turns.text: You came back for the book? Why?

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: My father didn't want it incinerated.

turns.speaker: ELSA
turns.text: Is that what you think of me? I believe in the Grail, not the Swastika.

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: Yet you stood up to be counted with the enemy of everything the Grail stands for -- who gives a damn what you think?

turns.speaker: ELSA
turns.text: You do.

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: All I have to do is squeeze.

turns.speaker: ELSA
turns.text: All I have to do is scream.

turns.speaker: ELSA
turns.text: I never expected to see you again.

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: I'm like a bad penny. I always turn up.

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: Elsa! Elsa, don't move!

turns.speaker: ELSA
turns.text: It's ours, Indy. Yours and mine.

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: Elsa, don't cross the Seal. The Knight warned us not to take the Grail from here.

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: Elsa. Elsa don't. Elsa. Elsa. Give me your other hand, honey. I can't hold you.

turns.speaker: ELSA
turns.text: I can reach it. I can reach it...

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: Dad!

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: Out!

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: It's important!

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: Then wait -- count to twenty.

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: No, Dad. You listen to me --

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: Junior!

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: It is you Junior!

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: Don't call me that, please.

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: But what are you doing here?

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: I came to get you! What do you think?

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: Oh, it breaks the heart.

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: And the head.  You hit me, Dad!

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: I'll never forgive myself --

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: Don't worry -- I'm fine.

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: Thank God!

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: No! Dad, get your stuff. We've got to get out of here.

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: Well, I am sorry about your head, though. But I thought you were one of them.

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: Dad, they come in through the doors.

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: Good point.

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: Humpf -- so I was wrong this time. But by God, I wasn't wrong when I mailed you my Diary. You obviously got it.

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: I got it and I used it. We found the entrance to the catacombs.

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: Through the library?

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: Right.

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: I knew it. And the tomb of Sir Richard?

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: Found it.

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: He was actually there? You saw him?

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: Well, what was left of him.

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: And his shield... the inscription on Sir Richard's shield...?

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: Alexandretta.  It's a great moment in Henry's life. He turns aside, lost to himself for a moment, then turns to Indy with joy.

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: Alexandretta... of course... on the pilgrim trail from the Eastern Empire. Oh, Junior...

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: ...you did it.

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: No, Dad. You did. Forty years.

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: If only I could have been with you.

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: There were rats, Dad.

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: Rats?

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: Yeah, big ones. What do the Nazis want with you Dad?

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: They want my diary.

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: Yeah?

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: You didn't, did you?  You didn't bring it, did you?

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: Well, uh...

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: You did!!

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: Look, can we discuss this later?

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: I should have mailed it to the Marx Brothers.

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: Will you take it easy!

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: Take it easy?! Why do you think I sent it home in the first place?  So it wouldn't fall into their hands!!

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: I came here to save you.

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: Oh yeah? And who's gonna come to save you, Junior??

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: No! Don't Shoot!

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: Don't worry. He won't.

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: She ransacked her own room and I fell for it. How did you know she was a Nazi?

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: Umh?

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: How did you she was a Nazi?

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: She talks in her sleep.

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: Ooooh... I like the Austrian way better.

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: So did I.

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: Let's try and get these ropes loose. We've got to get to Marcus before the Nazis do!

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: You said he had two days' start. That he would blend in. Disappear!

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: Are you kidding? -- I made that up! You know Marcus -- he got lost once in his own museum!

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: What am I looking for?

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: My lucky charm.

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: Feels like a cigarette lighter.

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: Try and burn through the ropes.

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: I ought to tell you something.

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: Don't get sentimental now Dad -- save it 'til we get out of here.

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: The floor's on fire! See?!

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: What???

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: And the chair.

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: All right, move! Move! Rock your Chair. Do what I do.

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: Dad!

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: Dad!

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: Dad!

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: Head for the fireplace!

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: Oh.

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: This is intolerable!

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: I'm out, Dad!

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: Dad!

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: ...the solution presents itself.

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: Come on, Dad. Come on!

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: What about the boat? We're not going on the boat?

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: Stop!

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: Stop! Stop!

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: You're going the wrong Way! We have to get to Berlin!

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: Brody's this way.

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: My Diary's in Berlin.

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: You don't need the Diary, Dad. Marcus has the map.

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: There is more in the Diary than just the map.

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: All right Dad -- tell me.

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: Well, he who finds the Grail must face the final challenge.

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: What final challenge?

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: Three devices of such lethal cunning.

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: Booby traps?

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: Oh, yes. But I found the clues that will safely take us through, in the Chronicles of St. Anselm.

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: But what are they? Can't you remember?

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: I wrote them down in my Diary so that I wouldn't have to remember.

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: Half the German Army's on our tail and you want me to go to Berlin? Into the lion's den?

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: Yes! The only thing that matters is the Grail.

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: What about Marcus?

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: Marcus would agree with me.

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: Two selfless martyrs. Jesus Christ!

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: That's for blasphemy. The quest for the Grail is not archaeology. It's a race against evil. If it is captured by the Nazis, the armies of darkness will march all over the face of the earth. Do you understand me?

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: This is an obsession Dad. I never understood it. Never. Neither did Mom.

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: Oh yes, she did. Only too well. Unfortunately she kept her illness from me until all I could do was mourn her.

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: What did you get?

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: I don't know. The first available flight out of Germany.

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: Good.

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: When we're airborne, with Germany behind us, then I'll share that sentiment.

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: Relax.

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: You know, sharing your adventures is an interesting experience.

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: That's not all we shared. It's disgraceful. You're old enough to be her fa... er, her grandfather!

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: Well, I'm as human as the next man.

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: I was the next man.

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: Ships that pass in the night...

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: Do you remember the last time we had a quiet drink? I had a milk shake.

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: Hmmm... What did we talk about?

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: We didn't talk. We never talked.

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: And do I detect a rebuke?

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: A regret. It was just the two of us, Dad. It was a lonely way to grow up. For you, too. If you had been an ordinary, average father like the other guys' dads, you'd have understood that.

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: Actually, I was a wonderful father.

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: When?

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: Did I ever tell you to eat up? Go to bed? Wash your ears? Do your homework? No. I respected your privacy and I taught you self-reliance.

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: What you taught me was that I was less important to you than people who had been dead for five hundred years in another country. And I learned it so well that we've hardly spoken for twenty years.

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: You left just when you were becoming interesting.

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: Dad, how can you?

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: Very well. I'm here now.

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: Well... I can't think of anything.

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: Then what are you complaining about?  Look, we have work to do. When we get to Alexandretta we will face three challenges.  "First, the breath of God. Only the penitent man will pass. Second, the Word of God, only in the footsteps of God will he proceed. Third, the Path of God, only in the leap from the lion's head will he prove his worth."

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: What does that mean?

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: I don't know. We'll find out.

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: I didn't know you could fly a plane.

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: Fly... yes. Land... no.

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: Dad -- eleven o'clock!!

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: What happens at eleven o'clock?

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: Dad, are we hit?!

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: More or less.  Son, I'm sorry. They got us.

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: Nice landing.

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: Thanks.

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: Those people are trying to kill us!

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: I know, Dad!

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: It's a new experience for me.

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: It happens to me all the time.

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: This is intolerable!

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: This could be close.

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: What do you think you're doing?! Get down!

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: Dad, we're well out of range.

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: Now, who are all these people?

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: Who cares? As long as they're keeping Donovan busy. Dad, you stay here while Sallah and I organize some transportation.

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: Dad?

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: You call this archaeology?

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: Get out of there, Dad!

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: Dad?!

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: Junior...

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: "Only the penitent man will pass. Only the penitent man will pass."

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: The penitent man will pass. The penitent... the penitent. The penitent man...

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: The penitent man. The penitent...

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: The penitent man is humble before God.

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: Penitent. Penitent...

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: The penitent man is humble...

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: But in the Latin alphabet, "Jehovah" begins with an "I".

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: Junior, give me your other hand! I can't hold on!!

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: I can get it -- I can almost reach it, Dad.

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: Elsa never really believed in the Grail. She thought she'd found a prize.

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: What did you find, Dad?

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: Me?... Illumination.
